Description: Lower body and conical foot sherd of Chian, possibly Simple Animal Style patterned, pottery chalice; much worn; white slip; interior glazed; exterior; bowl and band at top of foot reserved, rest glazed; inscription on reserved underside.
Curator's comments: The number in Petrie's catalogue, '45', is written in pen on the underside of the foot. For parallels regarding squat patterned chalices, see Lemos no. 1062 from Kamiros.
Bibliographic references: Petrie 1886 / Naukratis. Part I., 1884-85 (pl. XXXII, no. 45)
Johnston 2006a / Trademarks on Greek Vases: Addenda (p. 170, no. 12)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.1079) (phase 2)
